alert.note: Alert for Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 5:22AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Yalobusha, northeastern Tallahatchie, northeastern Quitman and Panola Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 522 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darling, or 18 miles west of Batesville, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Batesville, George Payne State Park, Sledge, Pope, Curtis Station, Enid, Darling, Pleasant Grove, Courtland, Falcon, Shuford, Mims, Riverview, Asa, Ballentine, Hinchcliff, Locke Station, Essex, Horatio and Eureka Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
